intro: Hieracium subulidens, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. Hieracium subulidens is a perennial species that thrives in temperate climates.
